The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York has released the list of fifty‐one artists who are currently participating in the fourth edition of the Metropolitan Museum of Art (MMOM), “Art in Motion: The Art of Motion.” The show opened on April 1 and runs through May 16. “The inaugural exhibition was especially challenging for us, in part because it is so broad and so fast-paced,” said Met director Thomas Friedman. “We wanted the show to have time to explore new ways of celebrating the Met’s long history in motion and to reflect on the Met’s current and future visions for the museum, as well as the ongoing importance of movement in our art and culture.” The twenty-one-person jury that selected the fifty-one finalists was made up of Jennifer Boysen, curator of public art at the Van Gogh Museum in Amsterdam; Markus Reiser, director of the Museum of Modern Art in New York; Sarah Sze; and Amanda Van Haren, head of the Brooklyn Museum.
